title: How to Drop a Pin on an iPhone & Share Location in Apple Maps

steps.title: Open the Maps app.
steps.content: Open the Maps app. This app icon looks like a road map with a blue marker. [1] X Research source Maps will open and zoom in on your current location.

steps.title: Tap and hold the map where you want to drop a pin.
steps.content: Tap and hold the map where you want to drop a pin. You can lift your finger when the "Marked Location" menu slides up from the bottom. If nothing happens when you touch the screen, try zooming in to get an exact location, then touch the screen again.

steps.title: Move the pin to a more precise location.
steps.content: Move the pin to a more precise location. If the pin you placed is a little bit off from the desired location, tap Move , then drag the map until the pin is positioned correctly.

steps.title: Tap Pin.
steps.content: Tap Pin . It's at the bottom of the "Marked Location" menu panelâ€”you may have to drag up on the panel to find it.

steps.title: Share the pin (optional) .
steps.content: Share the pin (optional) . If you want to send the pin to someone, tap the sharing icon (the square with an up arrow) at the upper-right corner of the Marked Location menu, then select an app or contact to share with. You can share the dropped pin with a contact by selecting Messages and entering the contact's name, or share in another app like Snapchat, Facebook Messenger, or Mail.

steps.title: Open the Maps app and swipe up on the bottom menu.
steps.content: Open the Maps app and swipe up on the bottom menu. You might just see a search bar at the bottom of the map. If you do, swipe up until you see the Library section.

steps.title: Tap the > symbol under "Library."
steps.content: Tap the > symbol under "Library." You'll see this next to the number of places, guides, and routes you've saved.

steps.title: Tap Pinned.
steps.content: Tap Pinned . Now you'll see a list of all dropped pins.

steps.title: Swipe left on a pin and tap Share.
steps.content: Swipe left on a pin and tap Share . This opens the sharing panel, where you can select a sharing option.

steps.title: Choose how to share your pin.
steps.content: Choose how to share your pin. If you want to send your location pin in a text message, tap Messages , select a recipient, and tap the Send arrow. Alternatively, select another app to share with, such as Mail, Facebook, or Discord.

steps.title: Open the Maps app.
steps.content: Open the Maps app. If you want to delete a dropped pin, you can do so easily from Apple Maps.

steps.title: Tap the > symbol under "Library."
steps.content: Tap the > symbol under "Library." You'll see this next to the number of places, guides, and routes you've saved.

steps.title: Tap Pinned.
steps.content: Tap Pinned . Now you'll see a list of all dropped pins.

steps.title: Tap the Information icon (i) to manage a pin.
steps.content: Tap the Information icon (i) to manage a pin. You'll see this lowercase "i" in a circle next to each pin.

steps.title: Swipe left on a pin and tap Delete.
steps.content: Swipe left on a pin and tap Delete . This removes the pin from Apple Maps.

steps.title: Enable location sharing.
steps.content: Enable location sharing. If you want to send a pin of your current location to someone via text but don't want that person to see your live location as you move, you can do so with this method. First, make sure location sharing is turned on: Open the Settings app. Scroll down and tap Privacy & Security . Tap Location Services . If the Location Services switch is turned off, tap it to turn it on. Tap Share My Location . Toggle on "Share My Location" if this option is disabled.

steps.title: Open a text conversation with the person you want to share with.
steps.content: Open a text conversation with the person you want to share with. If you don't already have a text from the person you're sharing with, tap + to create one. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap + at the bottom-left corner of the conversation.
steps.content: Tap + at the bottom-left corner of the conversation. A menu will expand.

steps.title: Tap Location.
steps.content: Tap Location . A view of Apple Maps will expand.

steps.title: Tap the pin icon.
steps.content: Tap the pin icon. Now, you'll see a location pin appear over your current location. If the pin isn't in the right spot, you can drag the map until it's properly placed. If you'd rather the person be able to see your location in real-time, tap Share instead, then choose how long you'd like to share your location.

steps.title: Tap Send Pin.
steps.content: Tap Send Pin . This adds the dropped pin location to your text conversation, though it hasn't been sent yet.

steps.title: Type anything you want to include and tap the Send icon.
steps.content: Type anything you want to include and tap the Send icon. This sends your location pin to the person you're texting.

steps.title: Open Google Maps on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open Google Maps on your iPhone or iPad. If you want to drop a pin in the Google Maps app, it's easy to do. This can be helpful if you need to share your location with someone who has an Android. If you don't already have the app, you can download it for free from the App Store.

steps.title: Tap and hold where you want to drop a pin.
steps.content: Tap and hold where you want to drop a pin. When the pin appears, you can lift your finger. Alternatively, if you want to share your location in real-time as you move around the world with your iPhone, tap the compass icon to select your current location, swipe up on "Your Location" at the bottom, then tap Share location . You can then choose how long to share your location and who you want to share it with.

steps.title: Tap Share to share your pin.
steps.content: Tap Share to share your pin. If you want someone to be able to see your dropped pin, you can select the Share option below the address. You may have to scroll right to find the Share option.

steps.title: Tap Share this place.
steps.content: Tap Share this place . The sharing screen will appear.

steps.title: Choose how to share your dropped pin.
steps.content: Choose how to share your dropped pin. For example, if you want to send your location to someone via text, tap Messages , enter the recipient, and then tap the Send button.
